forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. South southeast wind around 21 mph, with gusts as high as 39 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy, with a low around 55. South southeast wind around 20 mph, with gusts as high as 36 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between three quarters and one inch possible.

weather_report:
As the afternoon unfolds, Downtown San Francisco finds itself cloaked in a thick blanket of clouds, with rain steadily falling across the city. The air is brisk and carries the unmistakable scent of impending storms, as winds whip through the streets at a formidable pace. Visibility is notably reduced, and the dynamic fog hugs the hills, softening the iconic outlines of the Golden Gate and the skyline. The day's high dances around a chilly 59 degrees, with a slight dip as the temperatures begin to descend. With a solid chance of rain lingering overhead, dress wisely—a waterproof coat and sturdy shoes will serve you well as you navigate the slick streets.

Tonight, the rain promises to intensify, ushering in a cozy atmosphere perfect for curling up indoors with a good book or savoring a warm cup of tea. While the brisk evening air may compel you to seek shelter, consider a leisurely stroll through nearby neighborhoods to absorb the vibrant energy of the rain-kissed city. The droplets illuminated by streetlight create a sparkling ambiance, a little urban magic amid inclement weather. Embrace the charm of the season and let the rhythm of the rain guide your evening plans.
